summary: Thomas W. Sacco was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). He is listed in payroll and certification reports from April 1978, August 1978, and December 1978. These documents provide his name, and potentially his salary, as part of the committee's staff. The documents do not provide any further information about his specific role or responsibilities within the committee.
significance: Thomas W. Sacco's significance lies in his employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating his involvement in the investigation of the JFK assassination, although the specific nature and extent of his contribution are not detailed in these documents.
